Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Perch \Perch\, v. i. [imp. & p. p. {Perched}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Perching}.] [F. percher. See {Perch} a pole.] To alight or settle, as a bird; to sit or roost. [1913 Webster]
Wrens make prey where eagles dare not perch. --Shak. [1913 Webster]
perched adj : (especially of ears) quickly lifted up or out in attention; `perched' is obsolete; "a dog with perked ears" [syn: {perked}, {perked up}]
